images.caption: Figure 1:Visualization of accuracy vs. latency on ASIC for monocular depth estimation models with different backbones.

Figure 2:Latency profliling for 3 different resolutions using Metric3D with ViT-Large backbone. Vector includes activation functions (e.g. ReLU)
and element-wise addition and multiplication.
Figure 3:Visualization of outliers in various channels at the decoder[55]of Metric3D model on NYUv2 dataset.
Figure 4:Visualization for the activation data distribution of different channels in decoder withlog\logroman_logfrequency.
Figure 5:Visualization for the polished activation data distribution of different channels in decoder withlog\logroman_logfrequency.
Figure 6:The block diagram of the proposed hardware accelerator.
Figure 7:The schematic of concurrent execution, where the computation of Matrix, Vector, Load and Store can execute parallel.
Figure 8:Accuracy ablation for the number of calibration samples using ViT-Large backbone on NYUv2 dataset.
Figure 9:Latency ablation for different number of cores using ViT-Large backbone with 256x256 resolution.
Figure A1:Visualization of the quantized Metric3D (W4A4) with ViT-Large backbone for indoor scenes (top two rows) and outdoor scenes (bottom two rows).
